summary:
Applied Physics graduate, 4 years of experience at LUMICKS (bioTech), now as a Quality Engineer. Eager to learn new skills in new environments. Generally curious about new challenges and learning opportunities. 

Looking for an innovative company with cool and cutting-edge products and technologies. General expertise in optics, electronics, quantum technology, software development, anddata analysis. Interest in brain-machine interfaces. Investigating a shift towards software engineering, informal experience with python for data science.

Highly value a workplace that leaves the freedom to take ownership and initiative, and to independently organize my own work. Also, looking for an open and friendly human environment.

education.field_of_study: Physical Computing based on Open Software and Hardware Platforms

school.name: Liceo Scientifico G. Parodi Acqui Terme

courses.name: Physics and Materials for Advanced Technologies
Quantum Physics and Physics of Complex Systems

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for maintaining and improving quality of the manufacturing process of the C-Trap and z-Movi products from LUMICKS. Cooperate with R&D and Service to drive quality assurance and ensure an optimized and streamlined manufacturing and service process.

Responsibilities include:
- Analyze incoming quality tickets and investigate root cause and corrective actions. cooperating and coordinating with R&D and Service teams
- Define and drive processes to guarantee optimal information flow between Manufacturing, Service, and R&D team
- Integrate Service and Manufacturing data to create and analyze a comprehensive database of product, components, and processes quality
- Analyze quality issues data to create reports and guide product redesign
- Define and assign resolution of quality issues to relevant department
profile_positions.title: Quality Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for technical support to customers and (related) internal improvement projects. 

Other than normal tasks (previous position), responsibilities included:
- Train new members of the team on product and processes
- Define and drive internal improvement projects in terms of process, tools, service, ... Examples include setting up processes to streamline the service process, develop testing procedures and instructions, 
- Automate C-Trap Factory Acceptance Tests (FAT) through Python
- Own service data to analyze and initiate quality improvement projects that improve serviceability and diagnostic capabilities – all the way to product redesign if needed. Through inbuilt Jira reports and own-developed Python notebooks
- Contribute to technical documentation, both internal and customer-facing
- Be the second line of support for internal escalations
profile_positions.title: Sr. Technical Service Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for first line of contact for the customer (mainly research groups in the field of biophysics) and providing technical support for problems with the use of the C-Trap™, AFS™ and u-Flux™ and for questions on possible applications. 
With the company at its early stage, the position had big freedom in defining the way of working and processes.

This role allows gaining a broad overview of the working principle of machines produced by LUMICKS, developing expertise in the single-molecule analysis by means of the techniques of optical tweezers, fluorescence microscopy, and acoustic force spectroscopy. Knowledge in the field of optics, biophysics, microscopy, and microfluidics are developed.

Tasks involve:
- Provide first line remote issue diagnosis, troubleshooting and repair support
- Testing (remote/on-site) complex equipment and quality assurance procedures to ensure and sustain long term customer satisfaction
- Coordinate on-site repair visits by our technical specialists;
- Analyzing machine-related data, mainly through Python, ImageJ
- Cooperate with Sales and Business Development to ensure customer satisfaction and the success of their research
- Cooperate with R&D to solve technical and design problems, and to convey feedback and feature requests
- Organize and find knowledge required to solve problems (through documentation or asking)
- Define and execute customer support processes, from communication to organizing the documentation
- Set up and manage a system for effective Installed Base management
- Maintain and develop positive working relationships with customers, system users, local distributors as well as suppliers
profile_positions.title: Technical Service & Application Support Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Research studies focused on investigation of noise measurement and electrochemical functionalization of graphene. 

Developed expertise in Nanofabrication (Electron Beam Lithography), Laboratory Instruments (AFM, E-Beam, Wet Processing, Probe Station, Etching and Evaporation Techniques), Presenting Scientific Results, Data Analysis, Project Planning.
profile_positions.title: Undergraduate Researcher

profile_positions.description: Tutor for the Bachelor students in the subjects "Analisi I", "Analisi II" (Calculus), "Geometria" (Linear Algebra). Occasionally helping in teacher's classes and exams, if necessary. Generally working in classes with 30-40 students
profile_positions.title: Math Tutor

volunteer_experiences.description:
Participated in the Youth Trainers Academy (YTA) train-the-trainer event from Zero Generation, learning how to become a soft skill trainer (adult learning, group dynamics, facilitation, story telling, training design, and training delivery). 

Delivered training on soft skills like time management, effective meeting, strategic planning,... Delivered to students, young professionals, and companies

company.name: Board of European Students of Technology

volunteer_experiences.description:
Coordinated the 2019/21 Educational Involvement Program within the Educational Involvement department of BEST Europe, about Digital Education and the digital transformation that STEM European Universities underwent as part of the pandemic. The research outputted two papers presented at the SEFI Annual Conference 2021 (https://ris.utwente.nl/ws/portalfiles/portal/275025309/SEFI49th_Proceedings_final.pdf, p.119), and ICL 2021  (https://link.springer.com/chapter/10.1007/978-3-030-93907-6_6)

Reinvented the program (previously based on live events) to cope with the pandemic.
Coordinated 4 international online teams of European students from 6 different countries:
- Survey team: 4 people team that ran and analyzed a survey about digital literacy. Targeting STEM students across 30 European universities
- Interview team: 3 people team that developed and ran interviews about the digital transformation that the pandemic generated. Interviewed 50 universities in 28 different countries.
- Focus groups team: 4 people team that developed and ran 15 focus groups in 8 different countries, for a total of 147 students participating. Focus groups were aimed at developing innovative solutions to implement in digital education
- Data analysis team: 4 people team that analyzed the data from interviews and focus groups. Data were analyzed using thematic analysis and content analysis techniques.

JCI is a nonprofit organization of young active citizens age 18 to 40 who are engaged and committed to creating impact in their communities. Active citizens are individuals invested in the future of our world. JCI gathers active citizens from all sectors of society. We develop the skills, knowledge and understanding to make informed decisions and take action.

Secretary of the local group of Amsterdam International. Responsible for defining the strategy of the group, digital infrastructure, and membership committee. Participated in the art exhibition project in cooperation with a group in Japan. Exposing art pieces about SDGs for 2 weeks in a gallery in the center of Amsterdam, organizing an event with speakers and workshops on the last day, and donating the income to charity.

company.name: Board of European Students of Technology

volunteer_experiences.description: Responsible in coordinating and motivating a group of 24 students from 16 different countries for a 1 week course in Molecular Electronics.

company.name: Board of European Students of Technology

volunteer_experiences.description:
Part of the Fundraising Core Team, engaged in finding collaborations and keeping the contacts with companies. Working together with other students in a very international and diverse environment.

The association also provides training and workshops that help the members in developing soft skills like public speaking, innovation, leadership and more
